So good to stumble across this video.  So many nights, as a teenager, singing in the darkness of my bedroom to this song and the entire avenue..  bands like this made me who I am, and I shall never be ashamed.

I was lucky enough to be the recording engineer on this session. Dave Allen (producer of some great Cure albums, Sisters Of Mercy amongst others) was producing. Prior to recording the whole album at Jacobs Studio near Farnham, Hampshire. The band came down to West Side studios in west London to record three songs with Dave Allen. Dave's concept for this project was that the band should all play together and nail the songs live with no overdubs. This proved pretty difficult for the band who weren't seasoned studio pro musicians - I'm not sure how much they'd played live at that point. I think we might have had three weeks - a week per song to record three songs? I remember feeling very sorry for the band because they were just playing the songs over and over and over again and Dave would be saying 'sorry, not quite there yet - try that again'.  I was wondering if Dave would cave in with his concept and do what was normal with this kind of band,  concentrate on getting a good drum recording first and then build up everything on top of that, one instrument and vocal at a time. I don't remember him caving -  if he did, it was not for a long time. I remember a lot of tension in the band because if anyone screwed up we would stop the recording and they would start the song again. I realized though when we started the whole album recording a few weeks or months later, that although it was a very tough approach by Dave, it transformed the band. When they came back to the studio, they were a much tighter, well rehearsed band. I can't remember what the other two songs were that were recorded at the same time as Swamp Thing but this was by far the best song of the session and my favorite on the album. Such amazing guitar riffs and incredible mood.
I will always and forever feel very lucky to have been a teenager in the 80's. I was a huge Bauhaus fan.

songs.post_title: Best Gothic Music Videos of All Time
songs.comment_text: My younger brother committed suicide last weekend by overdosing on something. He was found with headphones on, presumably listening to something. This is his youtube account. He made a playlist containing 6 songs that was edited the day he passed. This is one of the 6 songs. With the method he used, he was dead after about 30 minutes, probably unconscious around 12 minutes. I like to think that it was peaceful for him with his music on. I love you Darius, I'll miss you everyday for the rest of my life

songs.post_title: Dark, gothic and vampire Music (instrumental piano violin orchestra soundtrack)
songs.comment_text:
So here we are, 10 years later, dear friend. All those adventures... all the wonders of discovery we shared, every new person encountered, and every lesson learned.

It's funny how time flies, you know?

It seems like only yesterday we were little kids, running around with sticks in our hands and buckets on our heads, "The brave, knightly duo." Patrolling the streets of our childhood home in ignorance of the world around us...

Where did all that time go? Back then, we were able to pull through anything, *do* anything we set our minds to.

Ten years have passed since you were taken away from me, from the life we lived, the memories we shared and the joy we earned in our travels. And though I stand here now, alone, old and crippled... nothing has changed.

You were my best friend. 

Even in death, you're *still* my best friend. 

And nothing will change that.

songs.post_title: Dark, gothic and vampire Music (instrumental piano violin orchestra soundtrack)
songs.comment_text:
Wolf: Do you not fear me?

Girl: I do not.

Wolf: Why? These jagged teeth have torn and devoured the hearts of countless helpless beings. These wicked black claws have dug the graves of endless corpses. Even this snout, stained by the blood of all my victims, is dangerous, for with it I find all of my prey. Does the sight of me not induce dread, child?

Girl: I don‚Äôt fear you for I cannot see you. I am blind. 

Wolf: Then, is the sound of my voice, my snarl, not enough? 

Girl: Hearing you speak, all I sense is a lonely creature. 

Wolf: You‚Äôd dare insult me? 

Girl: It‚Äôs okay to be lonely. I‚Äôve been alone all of my life, trapped in my world of darkness. I know your pain.

Wolf: No one has ever spoken to me this way... So, you do not care that I am a monster?

Girl: You are not a monster. You‚Äôre just lonely. 

Wolf: I... I am so terribly lonely. You are the first to ever acknowledge me as anything but a monster... I shall spare you, child, for, even without your sight, you can see far more than anyone I‚Äôve ever encountered before. You can see the heart, the spirit. You can see my soul. 

The Girl reaches out her hand. The Wolf steps forward, lowering his head and pressing it against her palm. 

Wolf: Thank you, my child.

The Wolf backs away and disappears into the dense woods. The Girl hears him leave and continues along the path, sure that though she can no longer hear him, the lonely Wolf remains close and watches over her, protecting her.

songs.post_title: Dark, gothic and vampire Music (instrumental piano violin orchestra soundtrack)
songs.comment_text: At first, I wasn't really getting how this melody said "vampire", even if it does have a clear horror tone to it. But then I realized there was an elegance to it, and what are vampires if not a hybrid of horror and elegance? Though not the perfect marriage of the two tones, I can appreciate having realized that both are present in a way that fits reasonably well with the title.¬†

Through passion, I gain strength,

Through victory, My chains are broken. 
My anger fuels my hate, 
My hate fuels my rage, 
My rage fuels my ambition, 
My ambition fuels my greed,
